violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: stub was never called with a function argument - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST ensure stub is called with at least one function argument before using yields().

lines.content: * CORRECT: Ensures stub is called with a callback function
// ✅ CORRECT: Call stub with a function argument

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Test pollution, 'already wrapped' errors in subsequent tests - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST call sandbox.restore() in afterEach or finally block. Sandboxes simplify cleanup but still require explicit restoration. Pattern: const sandbox = sinon.createSandbox(); afterEach(() => sandbox.restore());

violations.description: No try-catch block found. TypeError: Attempted to wrap [method] which is already wrapped - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST call stub.restore() in afterEach or finally block to clean up stubs. Failure to restore causes "already wrapped" errors in subsequent tests. Best practice: Use sandboxes with sandbox.restore() in afterEach. Pattern: const sandbox = sinon.createSandbox(); afterEach(() => sandbox.restore());

violations.description: No try-catch block found. TypeError: Attempted to wrap undefined property [name] - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST verify property exists and is a function before stubbing. Pattern: if (typeof obj.method === 'function') { sinon.stub(obj, 'method'); }

violations.description: No try-catch block found. TypeError: index unavailable - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST ensure argument index exists before calling stub.returnsArg(index). Note: Prior to v6.1.2 returns undefined; v6.1.2+ throws TypeError.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. TypeError: index missing or not a function - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST verify argument at index is a function before calling stub.callsArg(index).

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Error: stub was never called with a function argument - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST ensure stub is called with at least one function argument before using yields().

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Test hangs, setTimeout/setInterval never fire in subsequent tests - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: MUST call clock.restore() in afterEach or finally block. Failure to restore causes timer pollution and test hangs. Pattern: let clock; beforeEach(() => clock = sinon.useFakeTimers()); afterEach(() => clock.restore());

lines.content: * Example 12: Proper clock cleanup in try-finally
* CORRECT: Ensures fake timers are restored even on test failure
